Detailed Description

The GatiManager class is a singleton for managing GATI Servers within the host simulation.

It fulfills several tasks: (1) It allows to register and deregister GatiServer classes and keeps an internal list of all registered classes. (2) It listens to a predefined port for incoming requests from GatiClients and handles the connection request in order to establish a connection between a GatiServer and a GatiClient. (3) It fires events like OnConnect(), OnDisconnect(), ... to inform the GatiServers. (4) It handles the data connections and forwards received data to the desired recipient.

Member Function Documentation

BOOLEAN GatiManager::Broadcast (  const INT  id,
const UINT32  cmd,
const UINT32  length,
const void *  data
) 
 

Broadcasts data to all GatiClient which are connected to a GatiServer with the given ID.

Parameters:
id[in] : the ID of the GatiServer
cmd[in],: the command identifying the data.
length[in],: data length in number of bytes
data[in],: pointer to the first byte of the data which has to be sent
Returns:
TRUE if successful, FALSE otherwise

BOOLEAN GatiManager::Deregister (  const UINT32  id  ) 
 

Deregisters a GatiServer at the GatiManager and closes the remote connection to the GatiClient if there is one. If the deregistration was successful, the event OnDeregistration() will be fired.

Parameters:
server[in] : the reference to a GatiServer instance
Returns:
TRUE if successful, FALSE otherwise

the pointer to singleton GatiManager instance.

const UINT32  cmd,
const UINT32  length,
const void *  data
) 
 

Sends data from the GatiServer to the associated GatiClient.

Parameters:

BOOLEAN GatiManager::ShutDown (   ) 
 

Shuts down the listening socket and terminates the main thread loop. If successful the event OnShutDown() will be fired.

Returns:
TRUE if successful, FALSE otherwise

BOOLEAN GatiManager::StartUp (   ) 
 

Sets up a listening socket and activates the main thread loop. If successful the event OnStartup() will be fired.

Returns:
TRUE if successful, FALSE otherwise
